channel.title: Munger Place Video Podcast
channel.description: Munger Place Church is the East Dallas campus of Highland Park United Methodist Church. Worship services include both the best of the old and the best of the new. The music is rock and roll-based, sermons are both live and on video, and dress is casual. But at the same time, the services draw from 2,000 years of Christianity by incorporating some of the beautiful old hymns, prayers, and responses.

item.title: Better is One Day
item.description: We make hundreds of choices every day, small ones, large ones, easy and difficult ones. The choices we make matter. A lot. In this series, we will look at what to do when we face choices in life. How do we make the right choices, and how do we know if...
item.itunes:subtitle: Better
item.dc:creator: Rev Paul Rasmussen
item.itunes:author: Rev Paul Rasmussen
item.content:encoded: We make hundreds of choices every day, small ones, large ones, easy and difficult ones. The choices we make matter. A lot. In this series, we will look at what to do when we face choices in life. How do we make the right choices, and how do we know if we are choosing the best option? When life hands you choices, choose better.

item.title: Everything Starts Somewhere
item.description: Everything starts somewhere. For one man, it started with a promise. God's promise. The man believed, and through his faith, everything changed. God still promises. Everything starts somewhere. What will God begin with you?

item.description: The final clause of the Apostles' Creed says that we believe "in the resurrection of the body and the life everlasting." Why should we care about what will happen one day? The truth is, the Christian belief in the resurrection of the...
item.itunes:subtitle: Echo
item.dc:creator: Rev Andrew Forrest
item.itunes:author: Rev Andrew Forrest
item.content:encoded: The final clause of the Apostles' Creed says that we believe "in the resurrection of the body and the life everlasting."  Why should we care about what will happen one day?  The truth is, the Christian belief in the resurrection of the body speaks to our deepest need for meaning and hope.

item.title: I Believe In The Forgiveness Of Sins
item.description: A continuation of our "Echo" series on the Apostles' Creed, specifically the phrase "I believe in...the forgiveness of sins." Are you burdened by the wrongs you've done? By the wrongs done to you? Does forgiveness seem...
item.itunes:subtitle: Echo
item.dc:creator: Rev Andrew Forrest
item.itunes:author: Rev Andrew Forrest
item.content:encoded:
A continuation of our "Echo" series on the Apostles' Creed, specifically the phrase "I believe in...the forgiveness of sins."

Are you burdened by the wrongs you've done? By the wrongs done to you?

Does forgiveness seem impossible for you? Forgiveness is impossible for us, but not for God. Forgiveness removes the weight of the wrong, and leads to freedom. Through his death & resurrection, Jesus took the weight of the world's wrongs, making forgiveness possible.
